result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 4 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 12-21-2015 at 09:50 am

Defendant Antonio Garcia in court with attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Amy Schneider.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$250+cc+DVA+DNA, pp $50/mo beg 1-15-16, ftp 4 days RCJ for contempt.

Defendant Antonio Garcia in court with attorney Xavier Solis for attorney Aileen G. Henry.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft did not attend CCV on 11-14-15.
Def indicates there might have been some confusion.
State would not object to deft attending another CCV class.
BTC: Deft to attend CCV on 12-5-15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Garcia in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft's atty is out sick today.
Atty has requested a new date after the next CCV date.
BTC: Deft to attend CCV on 11-14-15.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 09-24-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 10-27-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). CG.    You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Antonio Garcia in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
